resource.chars:
11 Scroope Terrace
Cambridge
13 May 1873
RR [?]. 221

My dear Stokes

I have read Sir George Airy's
'Magnetical Observations on the Britannia 
and Conway Tubular Iron Bridges'

I consider that these observations supply 
valuable data with respect to the distribution
of magnetism in an iron structure of 
great size and tolerably regular form
and that besides their present value
these observations may be found valuable
hereafter in determining the question of 
the permanence or the gradual alteration
of the properties of iron structures exposed 
to great strain.

I therefore recommend this paper to be
printed in the <s>Transactions</s> Philosophical 
Transactions of the Royal Society.

Yours very truly,
J Clerk Maxwell
